content:
• Wednesday, August 3, 2011

  • Japan's Ministry of Finance steps in to check the yen's strength, sending dollar/yen sharply...

    Japan's Ministry of Finance steps in to check the yen's strength, sending dollar/yen sharply higher. Additionally, the BOJ is moving forward its policy decision to Thursday, suggesting the central bank will make an announcement to support the MOF intervention. Dollar +1.7% at ¥78.26. Japanese shares like the news, +1.1%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:47 PM | 2 Comments
  • ENTR

    More on Entropic Communications (NYSEARCA:ENTR): Q2 misses estimates on all fronts. Investors...

    More on Entropic Communications (NYSEARCA:ENTR): Q2 misses estimates on all fronts. Investors appear to be reacting harshly to a dual breakdown: both fundamental weakness in its earnings report and a highly bearish technical breakdown of the shares below its 50- and 200-day moving averages earlier this month. Shares -20.6% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:19 PM
  • ENTR

    Entropic Communications (NYSEARCA:ENTR): Q2 EPS of $0.17 misses by $0.01. Revenue of $61.5M...

    Entropic Communications (NYSEARCA:ENTR): Q2 EPS of $0.17 misses by $0.01. Revenue of $61.5M (+51% Y/Y) misses by 3.5M. Shares -23% AH. (PR).
     
     
     
     
    | 5:38 PM
  • GOOG

    Google's (NASDAQ:GOOG) Chief Legal Officer berates Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL), Microsoft (NASDAQ:MSFT),...

    Google's (NASDAQ:GOOG) Chief Legal Officer berates Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL), Microsoft (NASDAQ:MSFT), and Oracle (NYSE:ORCL) for their litigious approach to dealing with Google and its Android partners, which he says is "driving up the price of patents ... to insane levels." A look at InterDigital's (IDCC +13.8%) recent price movements makes it hard to argue. (more on IDCC)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:32 PM | 4 Comments
  • SUNEQ

    More on MEMC Electronics (WFR): Q2 results easily beat expectations. EPS tripled estimates as...

    More on MEMC Electronics (WFR): Q2 results easily beat expectations. EPS tripled estimates as the company responded to a sharp slowdown in the solar wafer markets with aggressive cost-cutting measures. The company also says it's acquired the U.S. subsidiary of solar-plant operator Fotowatio Renewable Ventures for $112M. Shares +4.4% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:21 PM
  • T

    Leap Wireless (LEAP) falls 7.4% AH after reporting Q2 revenue of $760.5M (+14% Y/Y), below a...

    Leap Wireless (LEAP) falls 7.4% AH after reporting Q2 revenue of $760.5M (+14% Y/Y), below a $779.5M consensus. The company had a net gain of 29K voice subscribers, but a net loss of 132K broadband subscribers. Total subscriber churn rose 1.1% Q/Q to 4.2%. Voice subscriber churn rose 0.8% to 3.6%. Free cash flow was -$170M. (previously)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:16 PM
  • S

    More on Clearwire's (CLWR) Q2: Retail average revenue per user (ARPU) was $47.59....

    More on Clearwire's (CLWR) Q2: Retail average revenue per user (ARPU) was $47.59. Wholesale ARPU (primarily Sprint subscribers) was $6.18. Retail churn rose 0.7% Q/Q to 3.9%, while wholesale churn was steady at 1.3%. Free cash flow was -$383.7M. As of 6/30, company had $847M in cash and investments, and $4.02B in debt. CLWR -2.4% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:01 PM
  • ATVI

    More on Activision's (NASDAQ:ATVI) Q2: Revenue includes $292M in online subscription sales, but...

    More on Activision's (NASDAQ:ATVI) Q2: Revenue includes $292M in online subscription sales, but only $29M in handheld sales. Sales from digital channels +13% Y/Y. Console sales +5%, driven by 25% Xbox 360 growth. As of 6/30, company had repurchased roughly $479M in shares through program authorized in 2/11. ATVI +3.6% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:45 PM
  • SUNEQ

    MEMC Electronic Materials (WFR): EPS of $0.29 beats by $0.21. Revenue of 745.6M (+66% Y/Y) beats...

    MEMC Electronic Materials (WFR): EPS of $0.29 beats by $0.21. Revenue of 745.6M (+66% Y/Y) beats by 45.8M. Shares +8.7% AH. (PR).
     
     
     
     
    | 4:41 PM
  • WEB

    Web.com Group (WWWW): Q2 EPS of $0.26 beats by $0.06. Revenue of $42.24M (+70% Y/Y). Company...

    Web.com Group (WWWW): Q2 EPS of $0.26 beats by $0.06. Revenue of $42.24M (+70% Y/Y). Company announces the purchase of privately held Network Solutions for $405M. Shares +24% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:32 PM
  • S

    Clearwire (CLWR): Pro forma Q2 EPS of -$0.71 misses by $0.22. Pro forma revenue of $293.7M...

    Clearwire (CLWR): Pro forma Q2 EPS of -$0.71 misses by $0.22. Pro forma revenue of $293.7M (+151% Y/Y) misses by $0.8M. 1.54M Q2 net subscriber additions - 1.5M wholesale and 39K retail. Expects 10M subscribers by end of 2011, up from prior guidance of 9.5M. CLWR -8.5% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:24 PM
  • ATVI

    Activision (NASDAQ:ATVI): Q2 non-GAAP EPS of $0.10 beats by $0.05. Non-GAAP net revenue of $699M...

    Activision (NASDAQ:ATVI): Q2 non-GAAP EPS of $0.10 beats by $0.05. Non-GAAP net revenue of $699M (+2% Y/Y) beats by $100M. Raises 2011 non-GAAP revenue forecast to $4.05B from $3.95B ($4.04B consensus). Raises 2011 non-GAAP EPS forecast to $0.77 from $0.73 ($0.75 consensus). ATVI +4.6% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:16 PM
  • PVAC

    Penn Virginia (PVA) finishes the day -6.2% after SunTrust Robinson Humphrey downgrades the...

    Penn Virginia (PVA) finishes the day -6.2% after SunTrust Robinson Humphrey downgrades the shares to neutral on valuation, and lowers its cash flow estimates due to weak production outside of its Eagle Ford project.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:10 PM
  • MS

    Bearish investors appear to be betting on a significant drop in Morgan Stanley (MS -1.4%)...

    Bearish investors appear to be betting on a significant drop in Morgan Stanley (MS -1.4%) shares, Susquehanna says, citing a purchase of 34,000 bearish puts that grant the right to sell shares for $16 by October’s expiry. The stock hasn’t traded at such a low price since fall 2008.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:59 PM
  • AVAV

    Shares of AeroVironment (AVAV +6%) gain after the firm receives an upgrade from FBR to...

    Shares of AeroVironment (AVAV +6%) gain after the firm receives an upgrade from FBR to Outperform from Market Perform. Zacks reports only 2 research firms out of 13 now covering the aerospace firm stand bullish on shares in light of defense industry spending concerns.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:57 PM
  • EXAM

    ExamWorks (NYSE:EXAM) is off -34%, despite topping Q2 revenue estimates and reporting an in-line...

    ExamWorks (NYSE:EXAM) is off -34%, despite topping Q2 revenue estimates and reporting an in-line EPS number. Investors appear concerned over the rising costs associated with maintaining growth margins, as the company's cost of revenues soared 219% Y/Y and SGA expenses jumped 158%.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:56 PM
  • HTHIY

    Nikkei reports Hitachi (HIT +5.3%) and Mitsubishi Heavy Industries (OTCPK:MHVYF) are set to...

    Nikkei reports Hitachi (HIT +5.3%) and Mitsubishi Heavy Industries (OTCPK:MHVYF) are set to announce the beginning of talks aimed at a merger. The combination would create one of the world's largest infrastructure companies.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:53 PM
  • SPXC

    SPX (SPW -14.5%) shares are punished for a weak Q3 EPS target even though Q2 results edged...

    SPX (SPW -14.5%) shares are punished for a weak Q3 EPS target even though Q2 results edged analysts' estimates and the company reiterated its target for the year. The Q3 shortfall is due to the timing of projects, SPX says. FBR says it likes the sequential gains in backlog for SPX's flow and industrial segments.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:32 PM
  • FIX

    Ventilation and air conditioning servicer Comfort Systems (FIX +19%) jumps after reporting...

    Ventilation and air conditioning servicer Comfort Systems (FIX +19%) jumps after reporting yesterday its Q2 EPS was double expectations on better-than-expected revenue. Despite weak economic conditions, the company says its backlog of business is steady and it's developed a solid pipeline of potential new customers.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:31 PM
  • SMSI

    Smith Micro (SMSI -21.32%) remains in the tank after reporting late yesterday that its Q2 swung...

    Smith Micro (SMSI -21.32%) remains in the tank after reporting late yesterday that its Q2 swung to a loss on a sharp drop in revenue due to an inventory correction and weaker run-rate at Verizon. The company also lowers Q3 guidance, citing continued challenges to bring its technology in line with changing demand.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:20 PM
  • IO

    Shares of ION Geophysical (IO -26.5%) plunge after the firm announces a new CEO in the wake of a...

    Shares of ION Geophysical (IO -26.5%) plunge after the firm announces a new CEO in the wake of a harsh earnings miss yesterday.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:12 PM | 1 Comment
  • NATR

    Nature's Sunshine (NASDAQ:NATR), a maker of nutritional and personal care products, is up 22.6%...

    Nature's Sunshine (NASDAQ:NATR), a maker of nutritional and personal care products, is up 22.6% after reporting Q2 revenue of $91.8M (+5% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.36, compared with a consensus of $91.7M and $0.26. The company's operating margin soared to 8.8% from 3.8% in the year-ago period. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:45 PM
  • PEIX

    Biofuel stocks (FUE -2.2%) move lower as a possible casualty of the debt deal, led by Pacific...

    Biofuel stocks (FUE -2.2%) move lower as a possible casualty of the debt deal, led by Pacific Ethanol (PEIX -11.7%) and Solazyme (SZYM -6.1%). Investors appear worried about the ability of cash-strapped governments to fund projects.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:31 PM
  • SQBG

    Martha Stewart Living (MSO), which soared in May after hiring Blackstone to "explore strategic...

    Martha Stewart Living (MSO), which soared in May after hiring Blackstone to "explore strategic partnerships," is down 8.3% following a New York Post article which claims the odds of Martha Stewart becoming chairman again "appear to be fading." Stewart is set to rejoin the company's board in late September.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:30 PM
  • MMC

    More on Marsh & McLennan (MMC +3.7%): shares are higher as  Q2 profit increased 19% on...

    More on Marsh & McLennan (MMC +3.7%): shares are higher as  Q2 profit increased 19% on better-than-expected revenue. Top-line sales from the company's risk and insurance division climbed 11%, due in part to strong international operations. Revenue in its smaller consulting unit climbed 13%.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:16 PM
  • BB

    While Research In Motion (RIMM +4.1%) is bouncing on the release of 3 new BlackBerrys, analyst...

    While Research In Motion (RIMM +4.1%) is bouncing on the release of 3 new BlackBerrys, analyst enthusiasm is fairly limited. Wells Fargo, MKM, and Caris are reiterating neutral stances: while believing the new models can give RIM a near-term lift, the firms think competition and pricing pressures will continue weighing on the company.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:10 PM
  • KRA

    Kraton Performance Polymers (NYSE:KRA) now down 32%, after gapping down some 14% at the open,...

    Kraton Performance Polymers (NYSE:KRA) now down 32%, after gapping down some 14% at the open, following earnings of $1.44/share that missed expectations of $1.48. P/E ratio has dropped to 7.7, well below peers' average of about 11.7.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:02 PM
  • DCIX

    Diana Containerships (DCIX -5%) reported a smaller Q2 loss this morning on solid Y/Y gains in...

    Diana Containerships (DCIX -5%) reported a smaller Q2 loss this morning on solid Y/Y gains in revenue, but missed Street expectations on reduced demand, higher maintenance expenses and increased fuel costs.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:00 PM | 2 Comments
  • BBOX

    Black Box (NASDAQ:BBOX), a seller of networking equipment to service providers, is down 13.9%...

    Black Box (NASDAQ:BBOX), a seller of networking equipment to service providers, is down 13.9% after reporting FQ1 revenue of $268M (+2% Y/Y) and $0.60, compared with a consensus of $261.1M and $0.80. The EPS shortfall is blamed on a "pricing initiative" that hurt margins. Black Box's FY12 revenue guidance is above consensus, but EPS guidance is below.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:41 PM
  • T

    Bank of America sees a soft Q2 for Leap Wireless (LEAP -3.4%) - due to report after the close -...

    Bank of America sees a soft Q2 for Leap Wireless (LEAP -3.4%) - due to report after the close - maintaining a Buy rating with a $20 price target. Analysts see the shift of cellular business from voice to data pressuring firms on the lower-income end of the model, including LEAP rivals MetroPCS (PCS -1.1%) and Sprint (S +2.1%).

     
     
     
     
    | 1:40 PM | 1 Comment
  • IBKC

    Iberiabank (IBKC +2.5%) gets a lift after its board authorized a 900K share repurchase late...

    Iberiabank (IBKC +2.5%) gets a lift after its board authorized a 900K share repurchase late yesterday, equaling 3% of Iberiabank's total shares outstanding.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:31 PM
  • HRBN

    Harbin Electric (NASDAQ:HRBN) climbs back from sharp early losses as it comes out swinging...

    Harbin Electric (NASDAQ:HRBN) climbs back from sharp early losses as it comes out swinging against a report from Citron continuing to allege accounting issues, multiple securities violations, and that the move by the company to go private isn't happening. "This report ... is a patchwork of fabricated evidence ... (intending) to drive the stock price down."

     
     
     
     
    | 1:29 PM | 1 Comment
  • YGE

    Though Yingli Green Energy (NYSE:YGE) just raised its Q2 solar module shipment forecast, shares...

    Though Yingli Green Energy (NYSE:YGE) just raised its Q2 solar module shipment forecast, shares are down 4.3%, in tandem with many other Chinese names. However, Collins Stewart and Wells Fargo are reiterating bullish ratings, noting Yingli's forecast contrasts with that of peers such as Trina Solar (TSL -6.7%), who have slashed guidance.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:26 PM
  • RBC

    Regal-Beloit (RBC -4.5%) is lower today after saying it will incur $28M in warranty costs...

    Regal-Beloit (RBC -4.5%) is lower today after saying it will incur $28M in warranty costs arising from a production flaw in select engines made in one of its facilities earlier this year.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:22 PM
  • CBM

    Cambrex (CBM +25.6%) shares are soaring the day after the maker of pharmaceutical ingredients...

    Cambrex (CBM +25.6%) shares are soaring the day after the maker of pharmaceutical ingredients reported better-than-expected Q2 earnings and revenue. Cambrex said sales rose 17.6% Y/Y to $65.7M; excluding the impact of a weak U.S. dollar, sales rose 6.9%.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:22 PM
  • QRTEA

    HSN (HSNI +10.3%) soars after the firm beat estimates with EPS of $0.60 vs $0.41 consensus on Q2...

    HSN (HSNI +10.3%) soars after the firm beat estimates with EPS of $0.60 vs $0.41 consensus on Q2 revenue of $747M (+8% Y/Y). "Continued increase in the penetration of our e-commerce sales, the expansion of our mobile business, and the success of our new online gaming site," contributed to the bottom line according to the company.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:21 PM
  • AAL

    US Airways (LCC +6%) bucks negative comments about faltering bookings from JPMorgan and trades...

    US Airways (LCC +6%) bucks negative comments about faltering bookings from JPMorgan and trades higher after reporting a record July load factor on a 4.9% increase in traffic. Higher fares also resulted in an 8% increase in passenger revenue per available seat mile - a key profitability metric for the airline.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:27 PM
  • KO

    Coca-Cola (KO +2.1%) is the biggest gainer in the Dow, and could be set to move even higher,...

    Coca-Cola (KO +2.1%) is the biggest gainer in the Dow, and could be set to move even higher, says S&P's Alex Young. He names KO as one of six stocks poised to benefit from a falling dollar and growth in emerging markets, joining fellow big-caps: CAT DE AXP IBM JNJ. (previously)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:19 PM
  • ADM

    Shares of Archer Daniels Midland (ADM +2.2%) bounce back after yesterday's post-earnings...

    Shares of Archer Daniels Midland (ADM +2.2%) bounce back after yesterday's post-earnings sell-off. CEO Pat Woertz explained the firm's global strategy and tax challenges during ADM's Q4 CC .
     
     
     
     
    | 12:01 PM
  • OPNT-OLD

    OPNET (NASDAQ:OPNT-OLD), a developer of application and network performance monitoring software,...

    OPNET (NASDAQ:OPNT-OLD), a developer of application and network performance monitoring software, is up 10.3% after reporting FQ1 revenue of $40.2M (+29% Y/Y) and non-GAAP EPS of $0.21, beating a consensus of $38.5M and $0.18. OPNET expects FQ2 revenue of $40M-$44M and non-GAAP EPS of $0.19-$0.27, in-line with a consensus of $43M and $0.23. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:01 PM
  • LXK

    Lexmark (LXK +3.2%) is trading higher after disclosing late yesterday it has resumed a stock...

    Lexmark (LXK +3.2%) is trading higher after disclosing late yesterday it has resumed a stock repurchase program authorized by the company's board over three years ago, and plans to repurchase $250M of outstanding shares by the end of the year.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:51 AM
  • CBR

    IT consulting firm Ciber (NYSE:CBR) plunges 33.7% after reporting Q2 revenue of $267.8M (+1%...

    IT consulting firm Ciber (NYSE:CBR) plunges 33.7% after reporting Q2 revenue of $267.8M (+1% Y/Y) and adjusted EPS of $0.00, well below a consensus of $282.5M and $0.07. In addition, 2011 guidance is being suspended. Ciber blames the Q2 shortfall on the declining profitability of five North American contracts signed in 2009. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:45 AM
  • OSGB

    Shipping stocks take a beating as overcapacity, slow demand and price cuts on large commodity...

    Shipping stocks take a beating as overcapacity, slow demand and price cuts on large commodity transports kick in to pressure profits. Analysts at Deutsche and Jefferies add to the negative mix with sector downgrades. Select shipping stocks faltering: OSG -6.1% DRYS -4.2% NM -5.8% PRGN -3.6% DSX -1.9%.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:40 AM | 2 Comments
  • SIMG

    Shares of Silicon Image (SIMG +27%) are soaring after its Q2 earnings beat estimates yesterday....

    Shares of Silicon Image (SIMG +27%) are soaring after its Q2 earnings beat estimates yesterday. A big part of todays move comes from the fact that the stock has been beaten down hard recently - declining over 40% since topping out in early March - and was due for a bounce.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:33 AM
  • SAM

    Boston Beer Co. (NYSE:SAM), producer of the Samuel Adams brand, drops 4.3% after reporting Q2...

    Boston Beer Co. (NYSE:SAM), producer of the Samuel Adams brand, drops 4.3% after reporting Q2 revenue of $134M (+3% Y/Y) and EPS of $1.09, below a consensus of $139M and $1.20. The company is lowering its 2011 EPS guidance to $3.20-$3.60, largely below a $3.58 consensus, and is considering price hikes to offset rising barley costs. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:22 AM
  • PWR

    Shares of Quanta Services (PWR +9.1%) ride an earnings beat higher, despite seeing  Q2...

    Shares of Quanta Services (PWR +9.1%) ride an earnings beat higher, despite seeing  Q2 earnings slip -3.6% on rising costs. The firm issued upward guidance on FY11 revenue, lifting its forecast to $4.3B-$4.6B.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:22 AM
  • BKS

    Talks may have broken down between Barnes & Noble (BKS -5%) Chairman Leonard Riggio and...

    Talks may have broken down between Barnes & Noble (BKS -5%) Chairman Leonard Riggio and media mogul John Malone (LCAPA -1.8%) over the possible sale of Riggio's 70% stake in the bookseller. The two appear to be at odds on how to value the Nook e-reader, in which Barnes & Noble has already invested heavily.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:16 AM
  • F

    Shares of Ford (F -2.5%) lose more steam after Goldman cuts the firm from its Conviction list...

    Shares of Ford (F -2.5%) lose more steam after Goldman cuts the firm from its Conviction list and sets a price target of $17. The carmaker reported brisk July sales figures yesterday, but investors sold off shares.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:10 AM | 2 Comments
  • BX

    Blackstone's (NYSE:BX) reported bid for Emdeon (NYSE:EM) is providing a lift to some other...

    Blackstone's (NYSE:BX) reported bid for Emdeon (NYSE:EM) is providing a lift to some other healthcare consulting services firms. The Advisory Board (NASDAQ:ABCO) is up 11%, and Huron Consulting (NASDAQ:HURN) is posting a 3.5% gain.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:54 AM
  • LINC

    Lincoln Education (LINC -21%) beats estimates for Q2 but craters after issuing a downbeat Q3...

    Lincoln Education (LINC -21%) beats estimates for Q2 but craters after issuing a downbeat Q3 forecast. In-line with the recent downtrend at other for-profit institutions (I, II, III), new-student enrollment was far worse than expected, indicating overall FY11 enrollments are likely to miss estimates as well.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:43 AM
  • NXTM

    NxStage Medical (NXTM +13.9%) pops after reporting record Q2 revenue of $54M (+22% Y/Y) and...

    NxStage Medical (NXTM +13.9%) pops after reporting record Q2 revenue of $54M (+22% Y/Y) and in-line EPS of -$0.10. The firm raises revenue guidance for FY11 to $210M-$215M, from $205M-$213M.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:27 AM
  • KFRC

    Government staffing services firm Kforce (NASDAQ:KFRC) drops 28.5% after reporting Q2 revenue of...

    Government staffing services firm Kforce (NASDAQ:KFRC) drops 28.5% after reporting Q2 revenue of $274M (+4% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.17, below a consensus of $279.7M and $0.19. The company expects Q3 revenue of $276M-$283M and EPS of $0.17-$0.19, below a consensus of $291.4M and $0.23. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:25 AM
  • AAL

    Shares of American Airlines (AMR -3.9%) leads the downward charge for airline stocks (XAL -1.6%)...

    Shares of American Airlines (AMR -3.9%) leads the downward charge for airline stocks (XAL -1.6%) after the firm receives a downgrade from JPMorgan to Neutral from Overweight on revised loss projections. Airline analysts say investors are assuming bookings will falter and corporations will reduce travel budgets.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:11 AM
  • CLH

    Clean Harbors (CLH +13%) soars after blowing away Q2 EPS and revenue estimates and upping its...

    Clean Harbors (CLH +13%) soars after blowing away Q2 EPS and revenue estimates and upping its FY11 revenue forecast by 12%. The environmental services provider saw profit growth from all units as it continues to reap benefits from the oil & gas industry's expansion.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:08 AM
  • MLNX

    Network processor vendor EZchip (EZCH) pops 7% after reporting Q2 revenue of $17.3M (+16% Y/Y)...

    Network processor vendor EZchip (EZCH) pops 7% after reporting Q2 revenue of $17.3M (+16% Y/Y) and non-GAAP EPS of $0.33, above a consensus of $16.9M and $0.28. The company expects its NP-4 processor, set to be used in Cisco's (NASDAQ:CSCO) ASR 9000 routers, to begin production in Q4. EZchip shares fell last week on Juniper's (NYSE:JNPR) poor results. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:50 AM
  • HRS

    More on Harris (HRS +4.5%): FQ4 profits were lackluster, dipping 12% as integration costs offset...

    More on Harris (HRS +4.5%): FQ4 profits were lackluster, dipping 12% as integration costs offset stronger revenue. However, the company ups its FY11 forecast, and the board of directors approved a 12% dividend hike and additional $1B share repurchase.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:36 AM
  • CTL

    More on CenturyLink's (NYSE:CTL) Q2 report: Lowers FY11 EPS guidance to $1.60-$1.70, from...

    More on CenturyLink's (NYSE:CTL) Q2 report: Lowers FY11 EPS guidance to $1.60-$1.70, from $2.55-$2.65. Generated $950M in free cash flow in Q2. Says net broadband customer additions during the quarter were hurt by a higher than anticipated churn rate. Shares -3.3% premarket. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:28 AM
  • MOLX

    Electronic component manufacturer Molex (NASDAQ:MOLX) is down 2.2% premarket after reporting FQ4...

    Electronic component manufacturer Molex (NASDAQ:MOLX) is down 2.2% premarket after reporting FQ4 revenue of $913.7M (+8% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.44, below a consensus of $916.8M and $0.46. Backlog decreased 1.6% Q/Q. The company expects FQ4 revenue of $880M-$920M and EPS of $0.39-$0.45, below a consensus $945.8M and $0.49. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:24 AM
  • MSTR

    MicroStrategy (NASDAQ:MSTR) Q2 sales were higher, $138M (+28% Y/Y) vs. 129M expected, but EPS...

    MicroStrategy (NASDAQ:MSTR) Q2 sales were higher, $138M (+28% Y/Y) vs. 129M expected, but EPS came in at $0.26 vs. $0.55, less than half of estimates. Operating expenses weighed heavily on the bottom-line, jumping +45% on personnel-related investments as the company expands its social media and cloud capabilities. Shares -7.8% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:20 AM
  • OPEN

    Morgan Keegan digests OpenTable's (NASDAQ:OPEN) Q2 results and lowers its price target on shares...

    Morgan Keegan digests OpenTable's (NASDAQ:OPEN) Q2 results and lowers its price target on shares to $90 from $111 after yesterday's $1M revenue miss. The firm notes the restaurant-provider shows it can be "tremendously profitable," but faults its ability to "hire talent." Shares -8.7% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:19 AM
  • TRMB
